comments.author: AssumptionExtra9041
comments.body:
Well to be specific, I did not particularly point out that it's great, I just said it's not bad xD

I'm a regular commuter in Zurich which is probably the heaven of public transportation. So of course I know what the standard should be. Yet, Vilnius could be doing much worse. Yeah, it's way too overcrowded, especially during rush hour. But that's unfortunately the case in most places...

The main issue is certainly the punctuality. But that's especially a result of traffic, as busses are for the most parts not separated from regular car traffic (which is a major shortfall of the bus system).

So I'd agree that it is certainly not great and also is far from perfect. And there's still much to improve. But I'd also say that it is fair enough and improvements might lead to rapid increases in quality.

Vilnius should try to get rid of cars as far as possible, especially in the center. This makes space for busses which can then operate much more frequently and reliable.
